wikipedia_page.main: Pamela Jennings (1964–2012), known as Soho Pam, was a homeless English woman who became well known in Soho, London where she begged. She was much loved for her affectionate, polite manner and was the subject of artists and authors.

response: His interest in art started at the age of six, copying Uccello's Saint George and the Dragon.  He attended Norwich School of Art and had a studio above the Coach and Horses in Soho for five years, where he met Francis Bacon.  Among his subjects was Soho Pam, a homeless beggar who peddled copies of his watercolour portrait of her.
